author: raz
title: Cardano event in a Parisian Theatre
description: Knowledge and awareness of Cardano and Project Catalyst, in French, in Paris, is lagging behind the English speaking world.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely Knowledge and awareness of Cardano and Project Catalyst, in French, in Paris, is lagging behind the English speaking world

It is  clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief by hosting an open door meet up, in a Parisian Theatre, where the public can meet, discuss ideas + learn about Cardano + Catalyst
 
This proposal does  show  how it adds value to the Cardano system by enabling people to meet, discuss ideas + learn about Cardano + Catalyst
 
  Key metrics  have  been stated. # of attendees, # of online viewers for the livestream, # of views of recording,  # of wallets created, # of nfts downloaded, # of IdeaScale accounts created, # of subscribers to Cardano community channels, # of social media tweets, RT and shares, # of proposals into Catalyst from being onboarded via this event, # of proposals in French with the help of this event, # of people onboarded into the Catalyst communities via this event
 
The key metrics and goals fall within the scope of the challenge
   
Proposal can possibly scale up by having more events. 

This project will have  have a positive impact on Cardano system by creating better awareness and involvement by Parisians.

I can say that this proposal   adequately addresses the challenge hence i have given it a 5 star rating.
 

If this does not receive funding for whatever reason, one way proposer can improve it is by continuing to build and send press releases to media of your country or social media relating to your subject. Sometimes that one step might motivate someone to view the link and add credibility for your project and give him a better idea on the project which enables him to vote for the project. 

You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise.

I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading. I have also been an event organizer in various capacities, both through my company and on a voluntary basis for youth groups and churches.  I also have run a web development company from 1997 and have been the author of many ground breaking projects in web and Flash related projects in my country.I have done live event with guests in studio, discussing various topics on the State Broadcasting Channels for both National and International audiences.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers  has  provided  evidence  of themselves with their skills and experience in management such event. His name is  given and  profile links on Linkedin are given.   
 
 The links are sufficient. 
 
I have visited the links.
   
 The proposers are experienced and competent to do the project.

 The type and number of team members required to implement the proposal is fully known
   
The team structure is listed along with various partners.
  
 The budget has  been given in detail.  
  
The budget is reasonable to achieve the set goals.  
 
The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required 

There is no plan for additional funding  if objectives are not met. 
 
 
Theres a realistic timetable  to complete the work
 
 
The proposal  gives a sensible and conductible plan for implementation.  .
 

Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are  described.   
  
The proposal has technical aspects which have been addressed 

 
The proposer has  identified risks in this proposal. He has identified Covid 19 risks, and has put into place safeguards and protocols. 
 
Given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully. 


 This proposal is well expressed  hence I have given it a 5 star rating.   


A piece of advice... You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise. A proposer who has considered this, would be looked on more favorably since it shows that they are prepared for various situations and eventualities
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a clearly laid out roadmap with milestones  
 
 There are Metrics listed. They are # of attendees, # of online viewers for the livestream, # of views of recording,  # of wallets created, # of nfts downloaded, # of IdeaScale accounts created, # of subscribers to Cardano community channels, # of social media tweets, RT and shares, # of proposals into Catalyst from being onboarded via this event, # of proposals in French with the help of this event, # of people onboarded into the Catalyst communities via this event

The problem has been  understood  
   
    The proposer has identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties. These primarily related to Covid restrictions.  

There are  contingency plans in place for various outcomes.
 
Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.

The information provided is  not sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal but the budget is very high hence I have given it a  5 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0: This event seeks to educate on Cardano through a series of TED Talks-ish event that will take one day. Being it only one day, it is most likely to be ineffective. This is due to 2 (two) factors, the lack of Cardano content that is bite-sized and structured based on easy-to-hard, therefore communicating Cardano in such a limited time will be challenging. Compounded by no mentioning of a clear target market. Rather than going for an 'all in one basket' event, perhaps a series of workshops that spans a certain amount of time would be more effective. This is mentioned in the proposal, where it seeks to achieve a certain long term goal, by having monthly events. Continuity is crucial to form a database that will act as validators to request further funding and just by having one event, the database collected might not be viable. Therefore perhaps in the proposals next iteration, to directly go to a series format. Although this proposals intent partially meets and align with the Challenge setting, it does not clearly state how this proposal will add value based on this particular Challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Based on the credentials provided by the proposers, they will most likely be successful in creating the event but given the plan presented, will most likely miss the Challenge setting parameters. The event itself is quite vague, though their long term target actually is more clear than what this proposal intends to deliver in the short term. The budget requested to materialize this proposal makes sense and is sufficient. Timeline though is also vague and questionable due to that there is a budget request for actions such as; marketing and project management, but it is not reflected into a detailed timeline and plan in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: In general, the information provided is more  towards displaying actions to be executed but not accompanied by how and when it will be executed, therefore making it difficult to audit. This can be seen in the budget break down and roadmap. Particularly in the roadmap, it is more of a lumpsum of things to do. KPI's are difficult to measure due to no existing numerical targets. The problem statement and solution actually interconnects but unfortunately it focuses too much on the venue and not the event itself. Seeing the proposers are educators, reckon approaching universities would be the most natural next step of their journey in Cardano.
f6_assessments.reply: The rationale for giving a 2 for impact is inaccurate: the claim that there i a lack of Cardano content that is bite sized and communicating Cardano in a limited time...talks given by people at 1 day events and workshops are designed to give an initial entry point and insights. Target market has been indicated in the proposal with ideas for who will be approached but also that this is an event that has time for further planning and input from the community (cardano community, community in Paris etc). I disagree with the assertion that the proposal fails to clearly state how value is added on this particular challenge - I think the proposal was not read throughly by the assessor. Feasability rating is 3 but the rationale does not match the rating given that the assesor has said that 'based on the credentials provided by the proposers, they will most likely be successful in creating the event...' Furthermore, a detailed timeline for project management should not be a reason for a reduction in rating as this should be seen as on ongoing administrative task by definition...'KPIs are difficult to measure due to no existing numerical tarkets' - I challenge the rating of 3 for auditability based on these statements, as the KPIs provided indicate that the number will be tracked, as such no such set number for a target is provided.

f6_assessments.q0: As the goal of this proposal is to create awareness of Cardano in Paris, it is in line with the challenge settings. Also the statement of what problem is to be solved is clear. The proposal seeks to create awareness of Cardano and that for me is going to bring a positive impact to the Cardano community. I appreciate the fact that the KPIs of this proposal align with the challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team are professionals per their qualifications: they have also included relevant links to justify their skills and experience. It is very good that the team members are known by number and names. The budget has been further broken down into identifiable items and for me is good. The proposal has also captured the way and manner it would be executed. 
A unique thing about this proposal is that it has captured the relevant risks involved in the implementation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap, milestones and time horizon for the achievement of the proposal are integrated successfully and that for me is wonderful. The proposal also has stated the KPIs that the define the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Great proposal and it's awesome to have Catalyst impact expanding to Paris. This will integrate participation from french-speaking individuals. This is great to break the language barrier in creating Cardano ecosystem awareness.
f6_assessments.q1: This is an experienced team and I have no doubt about their passion to expand the catalyst community in Paris. The proposal has detailed KPIs and impacts on Cardano ecosystem. This is achievable and would be a success.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a plan to make the activities transparent, well documented and open with a live recording of events.

This would make it trackable and easily accessible for auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal will be helpful in providing knowledge and creating awareness on the cardanao ecosystem among the community in Paris. Therefore, as far as this proposal seeks to expand the cardano user base, I agree that the project will be useful to the cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind this project, their background and experience is ideal for this project. Aside that, the proposal vividly outlines the specific audience for the project, including specific topics to be addressed. It also provides a detailed breakdown of the budgetary allocation for the event. Finally, the project provides timeline for the event and a clear work breakdown structure for the event.
f6_assessments.q2: The project provides adequate platforms to monitor and track the progress and success of the project. For instance, the proposal promises to film the event and if possible provide a streaming service for the cardano community; this will allow the cardano community to determine the success of each event. Also, the projects plans to develop a social media page for the events with the aim of providing update on each event; ideally this will provide the cardano community the needed information to know the progress of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal clearly identifies the challenge, it is a proposal that with adequate development can be very successful to bring Cardano to the Parisians and from there to all of France. His ability to add value to the Cardano ecosystem is evident and he has an adequate process to align the metrics. It is a proposal that is simple and at the same time profound due to its possibilities of impact. This proposal has all the capacity to expand for future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent presents clear evidence of the capabilities it has to develop the proposal, with a team that will allow it to be developed smoothly. The budget seems adequate and is clearly described. There is NO verifiable plan on possible additional resources, however it is not required, given the very simplicity of the proposal. It is simple and beautiful at the same time. The calendar seems realistic to me, although it does not stop worrying a little about the problems related to Covid these days in France. The proposal explains well the necessary resources, perhaps more work could be done on this issue. For risks, post-event disclosure must be addressed more thoroughly to improve impact.
f6_assessments.q2: The mention of the SDG targets seems highly relevant to me. The roadmap approach allows adequate monitoring and has good metrics. You have an adequate job to understand the objective problem and the proposal is very understandable. I really hope to attend this event.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is a thought-through approach at addressing the challenge, while breathing life into it through the charm of a theater, and adding the relevant aspect of having more content in languages other than English. The only potential downside is that the costs seem to be high for such a limited amount of people, and organizing it in a multi-media space, and with more space for small happenings besides the main action in the theatre-room, through which broadcasting to the rest of the (french-speaking) world could perhaps be done more effectively - although admittedly, this would lose some of the charm.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have solid experience in event organization and connections to the theatre world. Some parts where the proposal could be strengthened are to specify how attendes/invitees would be selected, especially given the very small number of seats; and in what way it would be a singular event or a series.
f6_assessments.q2: Full information is given regarding KPIs, progress and success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: The notes for impact appear to indicate that the proposal was not thoroughly read by the assessor and do not reflect a '3' rating. I.e the first sentence of the notes

solution: Host a 'porte ouvert', open door meet up, in a Parisian Theatre, where the public can meet, discuss ideas + learn about Cardano + Catalyst.
experience: Educators, entrepreneurs + sustainability professionals, catalyst Funded, trilingual (French, English, Bahasa Indonesian), Professional MCs
